We are to note that the special array is the one that was modified with operation2, which has a different effect on the weighted sum compared to operation1. Observation from the problem:
 Operation1: subtract 1 from c_t[i] and c_t[j], and add 1 to c_t[i-1] and c_t[j+1]. Effect on the weighted sum: 
        Original: ... + (i-1)*c_t[i-1] + i*c_t[i] + ... + j*c_t[j] + (j+1)*c_t[j+1] + ... After operation: 
            c_t[i-1] becomes c_t[i-1]+1 -> change: (i-1)*1
            c_t[i] becomes c_t[i]-1 -> change: i*(-1)
            c_t[j] becomes c_t[j]-1 -> change: j*(-1)
            c_t[j+1] becomes c_t[j+1]+1 -> change: (j+1)*1
        Total change: (i-1) - i - j + (j+1) = (i-1-i) + (-j+j+1) = -1 + 1 = 0. Operation2: subtract 1 from c_t[i] and c_t[j], and add 1 to c_t[i-1] and c_t[j+2]. Effect on the weighted sum:
        Change: (i-1)*1 - i*1 - j*1 + (j+2)*1 = (i-1-i) + (-j+j+2) = -1 + 2 = 1. Therefore, each operation1 does not change the weighted sum, while each operation2 increases the weighted sum by 1.

                #include <bits/stdc++.h>
                using namespace std;
                typedef long long ll;
                const int N = 300000;
                const int MOD = 998244353;
                int n;
                vector<int> add[N+10], del[N+10];
                int pw2[N+10], pw3[N+10];

                struct Heap {
                    priority_queue<int, vector<int>, greater<int>> q, p;
                    void push(int x) { q.push(x); }
                    void erase(int x) { p.push(x); }
                    int top() {
                        while (!p.empty() && q.top()==p.top()) { q.pop(); p.pop(); }
                        return q.top();
                    }
                } h;

                int main() {
                    scanf("%d", &n);
                    for (int i=0; i<n; i++) {
                        int l, r;
                        scanf("%d%d", &l, &r);
                        add[l].push_back(i);
                        del[r+1].push_back(i);
                    }

                    pw2[0] = 1;
                    for (int i=1; i<=n; i++) pw2[i] = pw2[i-1]*2 % MOD;
                    pw3[0] = 1;
                    for (int i=1; i<=n; i++) pw3[i] = (ll)pw3[i-1]*3 % MOD;

                    ll ans = 0;
                    set<int> active;
                    for (int i=0; i<=N; i++) {
                        for (int j: del[i]) {
                            active.erase(j);
                            h.erase(j);
                        }
                        for (int j: add[i]) {
                            active.insert(j);
                            h.push(j);
                        }
                        if (active.empty()) continue;
                        int min_active = h.top();
                        int k = min_active;
                        int left = n - 1 - k;
                        int right = k;
                        ans = (ans + (ll)pw3[left] * pw2[right]) % MOD;
                    }
                    printf("%lld\n", ans);
                }
